column2: AUDITOR(A) INTERNO (TI) Yucatán Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores Yucatán req5727  Estamos en búsqueda de un(a) Auditor(a) interno TI en Bepensa.Estudios: Licenciatura/ Ingeniería en Actuaría, LATI, Ingeniería en sistemas (Título Indispensable).Experiencia: Mínima de 3 años en extracción y análisis de datos, manejo de AX, conocimiento y manejo de estadísticas, auditor interno/externo, nociones de programación.Conocimientos: Técnicas de análisis de datos, programación, consultas en SQL (Indispensables). Certificación CFE (ACFE), Marco COSO ERM, Data Mining (metodología CRISP), software CASEWARE, IDEA y/o ACL, conocimientos de MS Dynamics AX, Oracle, lenguaje de programación  Python (Deseables). Servicio al cliente, paquetería office (Word, Excel, Power Point), inglés intermedio (comprobable), manejo de vehículo, licencia de chofer y automovilista vigente. Abierto a:-Disponibilidad para viajar-Disponibilidad de horario  Avisos Importantes: -Bepensa bajo ningún motivo solicita dinero en alguna de sus etapas de selección.-Bepensa es una organización comprometida con la igualdad laboral y no discriminación entre hombres y mujeres, así como con personas con discapacidad, promoviendo para ello, acciones en el proceso y promoción de candidatos/as, basadas exclusivamente en el perfil, conocimientos, competencias y experiencia; excluyendo toda forma de pregunta o solicitud de información en el currículum que sea ajeno al mérito, cualificaciones y/o grados profesionales como pueden ser el aspecto físico, estado civil, proyectos o planes privados de vida, opiniones políticas, religiosas, edad, tipo de escuela, nivel socio económico, embarazo, género, preferencias, orientaciones o cualquier tendencia que vulnere las dimensiones privadas de los derechos de las personas.

Plantilla: DISEÑADOR DE INTERIORES Ciudad de México (Distrito Federal) $9,000 - $9,000 Mensual  Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores REQUISITOS: ESCOLARIDAD: Licenciatura concluida en Diseño de Interiores, Arquitectura o Diseño Industrial (TITULADO) HORARIO: Disponibilidad para trabajar de tiempo completo, de Lunes a Domingo con 2 descansos entre semana. EXPERIENCIA: Proyectos, diseño de interiores/ interiorismo, conocimiento de marcas de muebles, diseñadores, colores, espacios, tendencias, texturas, materiales, gusto por las ventas.  ACTIVIDADES A REALIZAR: Atención a clientesAsesoría personalizadaDetección de necesidadesCierre de ventaDesarrollo de proyectos con clientesElaboración de presupuestosSeguimiento a pedidos y servicio post ventaDisponibilidad de viajar OFRECEMOSSALARIO: $9,000.00 al mes + Bono por Proyecto Concluido + Apoyo para Gasolina por $1,000.00 al mes.Excelente ambiente de trabajo.Capacitación y crecimiento laboral.Descuento de empleado.Vales de Despensa.Caja de Ahorro.Fondo de Ahorro.Gastos Médicos Mayores.Seguro de Vida.Transporte interno.Contratación inmediata y estabilidad laboral. Es indispensable que te presentes en la siguiente dirección para iniciar tu proceso con una identificación oficial en:Vialidad de la Barranca No. 6 "Centro comercial Paseo Interlomas" Vialidad de la Barranca No. 6, colonia Ex hacienda Jesús del Monte, Huixquilucan Estado de México, CP. 52787Horarios de atención: de lunes a viernes de 11:00 a 16:00 Hrs.O contáctanos al teléfono: 30882300 ext. 2376 ¿Cómo llegar a Liverpool Interlomas?Paso 1: Dirígete a la estación del metro más cercano hacia la línea 2, en dirección a Cuatro Caminos.Paso 2: Ya en el Metro Cuatro Caminos dirígete al anden "L" o "M" y tomar la combi que vaya para Interlomas (El letrero debe decir Interlomas - Herradura, Hospital Ángeles, Centro Banamex, Liverpool Paseo Interlomas).Paso 3: Deberás bajarte de la combi en la Parada del Centro Comercial Paseo Interlomas, cruzar la avenida y caminar al Acceso 3 de Proveedores, bajar la rampa caminando y al finalizar a mano derecha se visualizara la puerta blanca de entrada de personal.Paso 4: Te registraras en la Entrada de Personal con tu Identificación Oficial y subirás a las Oficinas de Recursos Humanos donde comenzaras con tu proceso de Selección.

Engineering Intern - Vallejo Plant México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores ENGINEERING INTERN - VALLEJO PLANT


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Vallejo Plant for the position of
Engineering Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you want to transform materials for winning consumer experiences?
Then an Internship as Manufacturing/Engineering Intern in our Vallejo Plant might be the right place for you.
In our Manufacturing department, we produce consumer goods to supply our customers with high-quality product, on-time, and at a low cost. We want innovate to ensure the development and use of the most advanced technologies. We value your creativity and skill in analyzing and solving problems.
Your role in manufacturing
In this internship, you will have the opportunity to be on the production floor facing different challenges. It's up to you to make decisions and the results of those decisions through. You will discover our leading technologies and in the end, you will build your own capabilities through the job experience, mentoring and training. Will you take the challenge?
You will likely be placed in one of the following areas:
Production ? Packing
Here you would work on getting our product into its final packaging and set up in palets.
Your mission would be to:
Work on the installation and startup of new equipment
Make studies on performance loss (on equipment, skills, organization)
Identify one or more key projects to achieve the performance targets of the packing line
Production ? Making
Here we bring to life our products- your priority should be flexibility while delivering the product in time. As you do this, you will see opportunities for continuous improvement. We are hoping that you will help us to eliminate any loss in the various production stages.
In this department, you will:
Ensure the communication between different departments (logistics, packing, projects etc.)
Craft learning programs for operators and team leader to help them to develop their skills.
Establish systematization tools, simplify process and standardize work.
Quality
You should ensure a consistent quality in line with customer expectations as well as in accordance with local laws and P&G's guidelines. We validate all the formulas and equipment prior to production, and are responsible for the study of “non-standards” to improve our processes and training of the entire plant to quality principles.
You will ensure that the quality of the products is optimal, as you:
Develop the quality indicators and audits.
Support the production (especially on equipment validation, process etc.)
Investigate " non-standard " and establish an action plan.
Health Safety & Environment
This team handles the environmental issues of the site, including working on our waste, destruction of defective products, water management and energy.
You will work on:
Environmental Management Site (destruction of products, waste management ...)
Conducting a study on the consumption of energy and water at the site and propose practical and sustainable solutions for improving and reducing energy consumption across our processes.
What we offer:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment.

If you are interested please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you now:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to encourage us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
4th semester-onwards.
Initiative and leadership.
Capacity for teamwork.
Creative and innovative skills.
Real passion for creating new solutions.
Good communication skills and team work.
Strong English verbal and writing skills are needed
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment
Job locations:
México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Part-time
Req No: SNO00002774

Sales Intern México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores SALES INTERN


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Mexico City's General Offices, as well as for Monterrey and Guadalajara, for the position of
Sales Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any business or engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you want to be in the driving seat, selling our global leading brands? Are you intrigued by the idea of building long-term business relationships with our customers? To develop and negotiate plans which create a benefit for our shoppers, our customers and our Company?
Then an Internship in our Strategic Sales department is the right place for you. We are here to help you gain a magical experience. We have internship assignments in the areas of Key account management, Shopper Based Design, Category management & Business Analysis.
What kind of internship projects you can expect:
As a Sales Intern, you directly receive important responsibilities as of day one. You are in charge for maintaining and expanding a long-term partnership with your customer by continuously proposing solutions and plans that meet their objectives. To do so, you'll develop a keen understanding of your product categories and markets.
Whilst building the plans, you will not only develop your negotiating and sales skills, but also your financial & marketing skills, analytical insights and logistical understanding as you are responsible for your client from A-Z.
You will be externally focused, on national key Customers, but also online retailers. You will get an understanding of the customers and shoppers needs. You will contribute to negotiations on prices, assortment, merchandising and promotions. You will collaborate with the whole customer team to prepare business plans and external negotiations.
You'll be part of a customer team in which trust, team spirit, real passion for winning and leadership are very important.
You will make commercial recommendations for a category (e.g.: Laundry with Ariel, Oral Care with OralB, Hair Care with Head & Shoulders etc.) in Mexico. Your mission will be to improve turnover and Sales fundamentals by suggesting strategic choices in terms of budget, assortment and promotion. You will work alongside the Brand leaders.
At P&G, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities, so that we develop our leaders of tomorrow.
Your role as an intern in Sales:
Developing and maintaining a productive long-term relationship with your customer
Acquire a deep understanding of your customer needs and requirements
Acquire an in-depth understanding of your shoppers, categories and market
Adapting and optimizing country commercial guidelines to your specific client
Negotiating contracts, promo plans and innovations
Preparing volume forecast and plans
Collaborating very closely with teams from other departments;
Resolve any issues and problems of your clients and act as a link between your customer and the internal teams.
What we offer you:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment
If you are interested please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you know:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals based on race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to inspire us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
4th semester-onwards.
Initiative and leadership.
Capacity for teamwork.
Creative and innovative skills.
Real passion for creating new solutions.
Good communication skills and team work.
Strong English verbal and writing skills are needed
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment.

Monterrey, Nuevo León; Guadalajara, Jalisco; México, Distrito Federal

Computer Engineering for Manufacturing México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Animación por Computadora COMPUTER ENGINEERING FOR MANUFACTURING


DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a role that will encourage you to become an IT expert?

In this role, you will lead all IT operations in our site and will collaborate with local resources to support IT components in the OT space. You will get along with Product Supply's and Global Business Services' functions.

You will be accountable for the following IT focus areas at the plant:
End to End IT operation
Operational excellence IT & OT Infrastructure & Networking
Systemic remediation of IT issues
IT Continuity planning (avoid unplanned downtime)
IT Compliance, Cybersecurity vulnerability, & Info Security
Our work plan is aligned with the site priorities and will require technical deep understanding to execute IT technical work. The leader will balance capacity in line with local needs and global GBS focus area.

What are the Technical Responsibilities?
Incident Management & Resolution: Demonstrate accountability and ownership to lead most technical incidents to resolution within the technical area and work with the team to pursue more complex or cross-technology incidents. Demonstrate deep understanding and critical thinking skills in solving issues related to applications, computing and network.
Issue Management: Minimize impact to business by identifying potential critical issues and alert management purposefully, elevating to right operation team.
Problem Management: Begin to dedicatedly and reactively provide solutions to prevent problems from occurring in area of responsibility, inter-operating with the our business and operating standards, key personnel and partners.
Implementation: Responsible for implementing and leading IT change for his/her site (review, approve, control quality of execution)
Continuous improvement: Find opportunities to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the IT/OT operations and work closely with IT Operations Leader & P&G TSP to deliver the agreed continuous improvement plan
Solution Design: Single point of contact for special project coordinator as consultant for local infrastructure needs within area(s) of technical responsibility.
Stewardship: Responsible for timely closure of the issues with quality. Support local Audit on all IT topics
Governance of Operational partners at site: lead local/global operational resources that deliver IT operations at site.
Service Operations: Lead applications and infrastructure components in a production environment. ITIL Foundation Certified would be helpful.
Application & Integration:Analyze and resolve integration needs through different application (local/global)
IT/OT Infrastructure Domain Expertise:Deep understanding of IT infrastructure with a strong desire to improve an expertise that is now recognized as a critical skill in the new IT career model. This includes NT servers, Networking, Firewalls, Voice, Mobility and Personal Computing.
Teamwork/Vendor /Partner Management: You will work in a highly matrix organization where boundaries are sometimes unclear. Works well across teams functions, and organizations and is seen by others as a proven team player.
Leadership:Ability to work effectively in a 'start-up' type environment. This role will play a huge part in fine-tuning this new role and identifying the work processes and business processes necessary to ensure Operational Excellence in a Plant environment.
Project Management:Ability to successfully deliver small to medium projects.
IT Security & Risk: awareness of cybersecurity requirement and support local cybersecurity team into the remediation plan
Basic in IT stewardship requirement and controls.
Do you have the skills needed to perform this job?
Communication
Risk Analysis ? Ability to analyze the risk to operations vs. the cost to prevent it and develop standard methodologies with policy-makers on IT Continuity standards.
Ownership & Accountability ? High level of capability for independent work, priority setting and ability to meet deadlines. Ability to flow to the work depending on business situation.
Self Starter ? Need to be able to handle onboarding quickly to a complex and dynamic environment.
Just so you know:

We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours.

Are you ready to inspire us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Recent graduates of engineering majors ? Information, electronic, etc.
Or, graduates with no more than 3 years of experience.

México, Distrito Federal

clientes.Atender y resolver las recomendaciones y
observaciones aplicadas por auditoria, en conjunto el Subdirector de Centro

Cajero Sucursal (Modulo IEEPO Putla) Putla Villa de Guerrero Oaxaca Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Animación por Computadora  
 
Te gustan las ventas y atención al cliente
 
Inicia tu carrera profesional en el mejor Banco de México y una de las mejores de empresas para trabajar (Great Place to Work).
 
Te ofrecemos

Un entorno dinámico que te ayudará para tu desarrollo profesional con enfoque comercial
Capacitación antes de ingresar al puesto y de manera constante
Atractivo sueldo, y excelente esquema de comisiones por ventas y bono de productividad
Contratación directamente con Santander
Póliza de Gastos Médicos Mayores
Atractivas prestaciones
 
Las funciones principales del puesto son
Brindar una atención de calidad al cliente en ventanilla para diversos productos y servicios bancarios, como depósitos, pagos, domiciliaciones y seguros siempre con el objetivo de ser un Banco Sencillo Personal y Justo.Requisitos: 
Gusto por las ventas, excelente atención al cliente y alta orientación a resultados
Buen manejo de relaciones interpersonales
Excelente actitud de servicio
Alta tolerancia a la frustración y trabajo bajo presión
Disponibilidad para laborar tiempo completo
Dinámico y con interés en tu desarrollo profesional
Licenciatura concluida o estudiantes del último año de carreras Económico Administrativas

Engineering Intern - Vallejo Plant México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores ENGINEERING INTERN - VALLEJO PLANT


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Vallejo Plant for the position of
Engineering Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you want to transform materials for winning consumer experiences?
Then an Internship as Manufacturing/Engineering Intern in our Vallejo Plant might be the right place for you.
In our Manufacturing department, we produce consumer goods to supply our customers with high-quality product, on-time, and at a low cost. We want innovate to ensure the development and use of the most advanced technologies. We value your creativity and skill in analyzing and solving problems.
Your role in manufacturing
In this internship, you will have the opportunity to be on the production floor facing different challenges. It's up to you to make decisions and the results of those decisions through. You will discover our leading technologies and in the end, you will build your own capabilities through the job experience, mentoring and training. Will you take the challenge?
You will likely be placed in one of the following areas:
Production ? Packing
Here you would work on getting our product into its final packaging and set up in palets.
Your mission would be to:
Work on the installation and startup of new equipment
Make studies on performance loss (on equipment, skills, organization)
Identify one or more key projects to achieve the performance targets of the packing line
Production ? Making
Here we bring to life our products- your priority should be flexibility while delivering the product in time. As you do this, you will see opportunities for continuous improvement. We are hoping that you will help us to eliminate any loss in the various production stages.
In this department, you will:
Ensure the communication between different departments (logistics, packing, projects etc.)
Craft learning programs for operators and team leader to help them to develop their skills.
Establish systematization tools, simplify process and standardize work.
Quality
You should ensure a consistent quality in line with customer expectations as well as in accordance with local laws and P&G's guidelines. We validate all the formulas and equipment prior to production, and are responsible for the study of “non-standards” to improve our processes and training of the entire plant to quality principles.
You will ensure that the quality of the products is optimal, as you:
Develop the quality indicators and audits.
Support the production (especially on equipment validation, process etc.)
Investigate " non-standard " and establish an action plan.
Health Safety & Environment
This team handles the environmental issues of the site, including working on our waste, destruction of defective products, water management and energy.
You will work on:
Environmental Management Site (destruction of products, waste management ...)
Conducting a study on the consumption of energy and water at the site and propose practical and sustainable solutions for improving and reducing energy consumption across our processes.
What we offer:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment.

If you are interested please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you now:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to encourage us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
4th semester-onwards.
Initiative and leadership.
Capacity for teamwork.
Creative and innovative skills.
Real passion for creating new solutions.
Good communication skills and team work.
Strong English verbal and writing skills are needed
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment

México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Part-time

Sales Intern México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores SALES INTERN


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Mexico City's General Offices, as well as for Monterrey and Guadalajara, for the position of
Sales Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any business or engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you want to be in the driving seat, selling our global leading brands? Are you intrigued by the idea of building long-term business relationships with our customers? To develop and negotiate plans which create a benefit for our shoppers, our customers and our Company?
Then an Internship in our Strategic Sales department is the right place for you. We are here to help you gain a magical experience. We have internship assignments in the areas of Key account management, Shopper Based Design, Category management & Business Analysis.
What kind of internship projects you can expect:
As a Sales Intern, you directly receive important responsibilities as of day one. You are in charge for maintaining and expanding a long-term partnership with your customer by continuously proposing solutions and plans that meet their objectives. To do so, you'll develop a keen understanding of your product categories and markets.
Whilst building the plans, you will not only develop your negotiating and sales skills, but also your financial & marketing skills, analytical insights and logistical understanding as you are responsible for your client from A-Z.
You will be externally focused, on national key Customers, but also online retailers. You will get an understanding of the customers and shoppers needs. You will contribute to negotiations on prices, assortment, merchandising and promotions. You will collaborate with the whole customer team to prepare business plans and external negotiations.
You'll be part of a customer team in which trust, team spirit, real passion for winning and leadership are very important.
You will make commercial recommendations for a category (e.g.: Laundry with Ariel, Oral Care with OralB, Hair Care with Head & Shoulders etc.) in Mexico. Your mission will be to improve turnover and Sales fundamentals by suggesting strategic choices in terms of budget, assortment and promotion. You will work alongside the Brand leaders.
At P&G, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities, so that we develop our leaders of tomorrow.
Your role as an intern in Sales:
Developing and maintaining a productive long-term relationship with your customer
Acquire a deep understanding of your customer needs and requirements
Acquire an in-depth understanding of your shoppers, categories and market
Adapting and optimizing country commercial guidelines to your specific client
Negotiating contracts, promo plans and innovations
Preparing volume forecast and plans
Collaborating very closely with teams from other departments;
Resolve any issues and problems of your clients and act as a link between your customer and the internal teams.
What we offer you:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment

Computer Engineering for Manufacturing México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Animación por Computadora COMPUTER ENGINEERING FOR MANUFACTURING


DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a role that will encourage you to become an IT expert?

In this role, you will lead all IT operations in our site and will collaborate with local resources to support IT components in the OT space. You will get along with Product Supply's and Global Business Services' functions.

You will be accountable for the following IT focus areas at the plant:
End to End IT operation
Operational excellence IT & OT Infrastructure & Networking
Systemic remediation of IT issues
IT Continuity planning (avoid unplanned downtime)
IT Compliance, Cybersecurity vulnerability, & Info Security
Our work plan is aligned with the site priorities and will require technical deep understanding to execute IT technical work. The leader will balance capacity in line with local needs and global GBS focus area.

What are the Technical Responsibilities?
Incident Management & Resolution: Demonstrate accountability and ownership to lead most technical incidents to resolution within the technical area and work with the team to pursue more complex or cross-technology incidents. Demonstrate deep understanding and critical thinking skills in solving issues related to applications, computing and network.
Issue Management: Minimize impact to business by identifying potential critical issues and alert management purposefully, elevating to right operation team.
Problem Management: Begin to dedicatedly and reactively provide solutions to prevent problems from occurring in area of responsibility, inter-operating with the our business and operating standards, key personnel and partners.
Implementation: Responsible for implementing and leading IT change for his/her site (review, approve, control quality of execution)
Continuous improvement: Find opportunities to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the IT/OT operations and work closely with IT Operations Leader & P&G TSP to deliver the agreed continuous improvement plan
Solution Design: Single point of contact for special project coordinator as consultant for local infrastructure needs within area(s) of technical responsibility.
Stewardship: Responsible for timely closure of the issues with quality. Support local Audit on all IT topics
Governance of Operational partners at site: lead local/global operational resources that deliver IT operations at site.
Service Operations: Lead applications and infrastructure components in a production environment. ITIL Foundation Certified would be helpful.
Application & Integration:Analyze and resolve integration needs through different application (local/global)
IT/OT Infrastructure Domain Expertise:Deep understanding of IT infrastructure with a strong desire to improve an expertise that is now recognized as a critical skill in the new IT career model. This includes NT servers, Networking, Firewalls, Voice, Mobility and Personal Computing.
Teamwork/Vendor /Partner Management: You will work in a highly matrix organization where boundaries are sometimes unclear. Works well across teams functions, and organizations and is seen by others as a proven team player.
Leadership:Ability to work effectively in a 'start-up' type environment. This role will play a huge part in fine-tuning this new role and identifying the work processes and business processes necessary to ensure Operational Excellence in a Plant environment.
Project Management:Ability to successfully deliver small to medium projects.
IT Security & Risk: awareness of cybersecurity requirement and support local cybersecurity team into the remediation plan
Basic in IT stewardship requirement and controls.
Do you have the skills needed to perform this job?
Communication
Risk Analysis ? Ability to analyze the risk to operations vs. the cost to prevent it and develop standard methodologies with policy-makers on IT Continuity standards.
Ownership & Accountability ? High level of capability for independent work, priority setting and ability to meet deadlines. Ability to flow to the work depending on business situation.
Self Starter ? Need to be able to handle onboarding quickly to a complex and dynamic environment.

Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours.

Te ofrecemos

Un entorno dinámico que te ayudará para tu desarrollo profesional con enfoque comercial
Capacitación antes de ingresar al puesto y de manera constante
Atractivo sueldo, y excelente esquema de comisiones por ventas y bono de productividad
Contratación directamente con Santander
Póliza de Gastos Médico Mayores
Atractivas prestaciones
 
Las funciones principales del puesto son
Atender con calidad a los clientes en sus necesidades de captación, colocación y servicios financieros, promoviendo una atención integral y de vinculación a las personas, siempre con el objetivo de ser un Banco Sencillo Personal y Justo.Requisitos: 
Gusto por las ventas, excelente atención al cliente y alta orientación a resultados
Buen manejo de relaciones interpersonales
Alta tolerancia a la frustración y trabajo bajo presión
Disponibilidad para laborar tiempo completo
Dinámico y con interés en tu desarrollo profesional
Licenciatura concluida de carreras Económico Administrativas
Experiencia mínimo 2 años en promoción y venta de productos y servicios financieros
TE ESPERAMOS

Executive Assistant - Digital Industries Direction México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Diseñadores web y/o digitales The role of the Executive Assistant is to provide full administrative support to coordinate and support the activities of Digital Industries Director. As Executive Assistant you will be responsible for ensuring effective time management of business-critical resource.
 What are my responsibilities?
 -Manage the calendar (and where requested, emails) of Digital Industries Director, arranging internal and external meetings and filtering appointments as required, including venue and refreshment bookings, and other necessary arrangements.
-Coordinate the logistics and activities of Digital Industries Director, including travel and accommodation arrangements.
-Manage as required key internal and external customers contacts of Digital Industries Director, building relationships with key people, and resolving issues as and when required.
-Documentation support via word processing, excel and graphic skills, including preparation of letters, short reports and power point presentations.
-Prepare/draft meeting agendas and supporting paperwork, as appropriate, ensuring circulation to relevant individuals.
-Provide a confidential administrative service to Digital Industries Director to include clerical duties (e.g. photocopying, binding, postal duties).
 What do I need to qualify for the role?

-Experience of supporting senior managers within a corporate business.
-Significant administrative experience.
-Track record of working within a secure and confidential environment.
-Main Skills ? Attention to Detail, Precision, Proactivity, Team work.
-Expert level MS Office User.
- Advanced English is required, Desirable German.

Asesor de Ventas de Audio Benito Juárez, Quintana Roo $13,000 - $16,000 Mensual  Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo, Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Productor Audiovisual En Hi Tech Audio queremos que en cada espectáculo, evento y producción de México el público vibre con nuestros sistemas profesionales de audio e iluminación.Desde hace 16 años importamos y comercializamos los mejores equipos para que los profesionales del entretenimiento y la cultura lleven a cabo sus proyectos y sueños. Nuestro compromiso es brindar soluciones que satisfagan las expectativas y necesidades de nuestros clientes, compañeros, proveedores y accionistas.Tu trabajo Integrarte a nuestro equipo de ventas en Sucursal para que puedas desarrollar una carrera en audio e iluminación profesional, contribuyendo a acercar nuestros productos a profesionales que como tú disfrutan de la excelencia. Brindarás asesoría y demostraciones especializadas a nuestros clientes, para que así puedan seleccionar los productos más adecuados. En resumen podrás desarrollar una carrera con nosotros, crecer hasta llegar a atender a las grandes empresas que hoy producen los más importantes espectáculos, siempre a través de relaciones de sanas y satisfactorias entre tú, los clientes y todos los miembros de nuestra familia Hi Tech Audio.Experiencia· De 21 a 26 años de edad.· Sin experiencia previa. Buscamos gente apasionada que busque un lugar donde hacer la diferencia, listos para encarar cualquier desafío y que, a través de sus habilidades y conocimientos consigan hacer crecer nuestra organización, porque estamos convencidos de que la mejor gente forma la mejor compañía.·   Modernas instalaciones y excelente ubicación en Cancún Quintana Roo.·   Buen ambiente de trabajo.·   Horario de lunes a viernes (medio tiempo para estudiantes, tiempo completo para pasantes) y sábado medio tiempo.·  Atractiva compensación.·  Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores y Seguro de Vida.·  Vacaciones superiores a ley.¡Ésta es tu oportunidad!Para postularte, envíanos antes del 20 de abril de 2019 una Carta de Presentación y tu Currículum al correo de contacto:Tel: 71001291En tu carta de presentación por favor incluye una explicación de por qué eres tú la persona que debe formar parte de esta experiencia con Hi Tech Audio. Se asegura que los estudiantes se apeguen a las normas y políticas institucionales en diferentes temas y que los proyectos se ejecuten correctamente y ayudan a dar solución a las situaciones función (materiales, herramienta, equipos, recursos físicos, etc.).Seguimiento y análisis de resultados de Grupos Estudiantiles.Apoyo en la organización de los eventos de la Dirección.Asegurar que los alumnos conozcan la normativa y procesos institucionales (administrativos, financieros, operativos y de comunicación).Autorizar y canalizar las peticiones de los alumnos a las áreas de apoyo (Legal, Finanzas, Seguridad, Logística, Planta Física).Asegurar la generación de reportes de indicadores del área de Soporte a Proyectos Estudiantiles.Determinar acciones a seguir con cada proyecto que los montajes y desmontajes de los proyectos estudiantiles se hagan en tiempo y forma, que los pagos estén al día.Determinar estrategia de internacionalización de los proyectos para compartir stakeholders involucrados.Dar seguimiento a las peticiones y necesidades de los estudiantes para sus proyectos estudiantiles. Este puesto es para ti si: Tienes experiencia de más de 1 año en servicio al cliente, coordinación de eventos (producción, montaje, desmontaje, etc.) y análisis de presupuesto.Hablas ingles a nivel intermedio - avanzadoHas liderado equipos de trabajos Si eres una persona que estás buscando.   Ubicación: Monterrey, N.L.

Intern Human Resources México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores INTERN HUMAN RESOURCES


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Interlomas´ General Offices for the position of
Human Resources Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any business, humanities or engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you have a passion for developing people to improve their contributions to the organization? Are you ready to start a professional career while you're finishing your studies?
Meaningful work from Day One:
We're more than just benefits and payroll. In Human Resources, you'll be a business-integrated partner at the heart of helping some of the world's greatest professional talent ? including yourself ?.
You'll drive growth with our business leaders across the globe, enable our people to perform at their peak each day, nurture our culture through inclusion, mentoring, policy and stewardship, and more.
You will be responsible for leading organizations through assessment, design, transition, work process improvements or working directly with a function. This is not your typical HR internship, you will have truly meaningful projects to work on.
All of our roles provide competitive compensation as well as the chance to define your skills, apply them in a professional setting, and have a direct impact on business results. At this internship, your projects will deliver leading edge deep understanding in areas such as benefits, compensation, employee and labor relations, recruiting, training, and development.
What we offer you:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment

If you are interested please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you now:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to encourage us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
4th semester-onwards.
Initiative and leadership.
Capacity for teamwork.
Creative and innovative skills.
Real passion for creating new solutions.
Good communication skills and team work.
Strong English verbal and writing skills are needed
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment.
Job locations:
México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Part-time
Req No: HR 00003339

GRUPO AXO	En 1994 escribimos las reglas de este negocio, y desde entonces construimos los cambios con un destino en mente y unificamos el “espíritu de negocio” con nuestra propia pasión: la confianza. Hoy somos la referencia obligada, un aliado poderoso para nuestros socios y el recurso más certero para las firmas que confían en nosotros. El futuro, aunque incierto para todos, nos encanta. Porque de algo estamos seguros: estaremos ahí. Acercando a las mejores marcas con las personas a quienes apasionan, de formas que aún nadie ha imaginado. DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents for our Interlomas´ General Offices for the position of
Information Technology Internship
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: part-time with flexible working hours
Duration: 6-18 months
Profile: Active college student of any business or engineering major
Qualifications: 4th semester-onwards.
Description:
Do you have a passion for developing new solutions and do you want to improve your skills to bring groundbreaking, technology-based capabilities and automation to life? If so, we inviting you to apply to the IT internship at P&G.
A career in IT builds change leadership and influence skills, breadth of experience across multiple businesses, and depth of expertise in areas like Application & Integration, Infrastructure, Data & Analytics, and Security & Risk.
Meaningful work from Day One:
You will be part of an intern project to build a solution, craft an IT innovation strategy for a business, cyber-protect our critical information systems and assets, or implement a project with a strategic supplier, your real passion for technology and its business application will be recognized and rewarded.
You will be able to improve business, innovation and technology integrate to create a competitive advantage for P&G.
What we offer:
Training and constant development with possibilities of a Full Time job after graduation.
Meaningful projects with an impact on the business.
Multifunctional and teamwork environment with a high level of interaction with managers.
Competitive scholarship and benefits package.
Flextime to work.
Continuous mentorship ? you'll work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Inclusive and respectful work environment.
If you are interested please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you now:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to encourage us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
4th semester-onwards.
Initiative and leadership.
Capacity for teamwork.
Creative and innovative skills.
Real passion for creating new solutions.
Good communication skills and team work.
Strong English verbal and writing skills are needed
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment.
Job locations:
México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Part-time

Project Management Quality Engineer - San Luis Potosi

Project Management Quality Engineer - San Luis Potosi* San Luis Potosí, San Luis Potosí Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Ilustrador Company Description
Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.
Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 16,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.
Job Description
Our Project Management Quality are in charge of planning and execution of advanced preventive quality tasks and releasing of purchased parts.
Main activities:
Preventive Quality Planning
Preventive Quality Execution / Assurance  
Release for purchased components, Approves PPAP/PPAP
Specific activities:
1.     Defines preventive quality elements for each component and supplier based on the understood cause and effect relationships.
2.     Ensures iterative handling of Special Characteristics under consideration of the complete value (supply) chain.
With engineering and manufacturing.
Integrates supplier feedback regarding manufacturability and testing concept.
3.     Participates in sourcing meeting with focus on quality aspects.
4.     Defines sampling requirements, evaluation and release of samples (new parts and changes).
5.     Triggers and releases measuring comparison before initial sampling (measuring done by PQA).
7.     Defines and validates traceability requirements with supplier
8.     Defines and follows-up Safe Launch activities.
9.     Considers series experience / lessons learned of other projects
Qualifications
We are looking for 3 or more years of experiences on:
Quality methods and tools.
LAFT
Requirements and level type of PAPP.
Production or Quality management.
Project management.
Automotive manufacturing environment.
Quality systems experience / expertise including auditing.
If you have previous experience on : SQA, STA or SQE, that is great!
 We are looking for this kind of competences:
Methodical/organized.
Analytic.
Team worker.
Profency english: advanced.
Additional Information
Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology - with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.

Team Leader (Líder de equipo) Toluca, Estado de México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores Company Description
"Located 70 km from Mexico City, Bosch Plant in Toluca (TlP) has manufactured since 1966 a wide range of products for the Automotive Business for Electrical Drives (ED) and Gasoline Systems (GS) Divisions.
Our strategy is shown in the Excellence Wheel, we are driving the change to be the Plant No. 1 in NA."
Job Description
As a member of the BBM Cost Engineering Community you will use your skills and knowledge in product cost management along the product life cycle. You will be the primary contact for engineering, plants and purchasing units across all divisions to support cost engineering in the entire NA region.
Your responsibilities will include:
Creating cost transparency by conducting cost structure analyses and calculations with standard application, called Siemens Teamcenter Product Cost Management (TcPCM) to determine product cost and cost drivers for purchased parts and internally manufactured parts
Supporting Design to Cost, Ratio Potential Processes (RPP), Purchase and Sales Price Analyses processes
Providing input to knowledge management by setting up reference processes and guideline values for specific manufacturing technologies (e.g. stamping, machining, forging, ?), also considering the specifics of your region
Providing master data in the region
Compiling reports for stakeholders describing cost structures and cost drivers and identifying levers for product cost optimization
Training other associates in cost engineering using TcPCM and in conducting cost structure analyses for specific manufacturing technologies
Qualifications
Industrial or mechanical Engineering background with Bachelor's degree or above
5-10 years' experience in production planning / manufacturing processes / project management in related material fields.
Good knowledge in Cost Structure Analysis, Value Stream Mapping, Lean Production is desired
Understanding of the basis in costing and calculation principles
Additional Information
"Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 13,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates."

DISEÑADOR DE EMPAQUE SR - CHI (jua) Juárez, Chihuahua Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo, Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Diseñador Industrial Eres quien nos ayudará a dar un servicio excepcional a nuestros clientes formando parte de un equipo exitoso de gente innovadora con valores sólidos mediante el diseño de empaques personalizados e innovadores para una variedad de clientes e industrias. ¿Qué harás en Veritiv?·        Apoyarás al equipo de ventas generando, evaluando, refinando ideas y prototipos de alta calidad para una mejor solución de empaque que presentarás al cliente con un plan de acción integral. ·        Revisarás el diseño, la fabricación y los materiales del empaque para reducir el costo total del mismo.·        Llevarás a cabo auditorías de empaque, revisiones de especificaciones, pruebas de laboratorio y estudios de los conceptos del empaque en sitio.·        Utilizarás el equipo automatizado para imprimir, precortar, desmontar, pegar y ensamblar los componentes del empaque ·        Gestionarás y priorizarás varios proyectos de manera simultánea.·        Estarás actualizado en Artios CAD, Tops/CAPE, Solidworks y otros software estándares de la industria y desarrollos de tecnología relativos al diseño de empaque. ¿Qué necesitas? Embedded Test Engineer Jr. Guanajuato Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Arquitectura y Diseño de Interiores Company Description
Robert Bosch Engineering and Business Solutions Private Limited (RBEI),  is a 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH, one of the world's leading global supplier of technology and services, offering end to end engineering, IT and Business solutions.

With over 18000
associates, RBEI is the largest software development center of Bosch  outside Germany, indicating we are the Technology Powerhouse of Bosch in India. We have a global footprint with presence in US, Europe and the Asia Pacific region. RBEI is ISO 9001:2008 certified (2012), appraised  at CMMI-L5 as per version 1.3 (2011), ASPICE - level3 based on version  2.5 and ISO 15504- 5 and 7, and also ISO 27001 with seven
state-of-the-art facilities spread across Bangalore and Coimbatore in  India, Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam and Guadalajara in Mexico, ISO/IEC
20000-1:2011 certified (2014).

We nurture, build and sustain enduring customer relationships to enable direct operational and strategic benefits to our customers. We make it happen through qualified, motivated and flexible professional associates, who uphold the heritage and values of Bosch - time-tested over 125 years of a successful journey; a journey marked by quality, reliability and innovation of service to enhance the interest of our customers and the community we live in.

We provide solutions for businesses in primarily three areas:

?Engineering Services
?IT services
?Business services

Our focal industries:

?Automotive industry
?Industrial Technology
?Consumer Goods and Building Technology.

Our role
“We see RBEI as helping us to achieve the technological lead we need to  have in order to prevail in increasingly competitive world markets?..  RBEI is about ensuring product excellence under conditions that allow us to maintain our global competitiveness” ? Mr. Franz Fehrenbach, Chairman of the Board of Management, Robert Bosch GmbH.
Job Description
Test Engineer will be involved in a multicultural team for the Battery Management System of Electric Vehicles.
The activities to be performed for this role are requirements analysis, test cases design, execution and reporting.
Qualifications
B.E in Electronics and Communication, Control Systems
1-2 years of work experience in software development.
Knowledge of Testing Techniques
HiL Testing
Use of Vector Tools
Scripting for Tests Automation
ECU-TEST
Requirements analysis
Knowledge of test script programming languages and test automation
Familiar with requirements management tools and software development processes
Software testing experience in embedded systems (preferably in automotive domain)
Additional Information
By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce and are an equal opportunity employer. Robert Bosch welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

Some for a few quick edits, and others on a deeper level at the direction of the Social Media Team, the Art Director, SME, other Designers and Video Editors. Expected to meet hard deadlines, make quick revisions, and be able to work directly with internal clients.?	Assignment of multiple projects every week, and expected to complete projects in a timely manner.?	Collaboration on assignments with other Designers, Videographers, and Creative Managers.?	Possess a keen sense of vision and the ability to tell a visual story in fresh ways.?	Optimize raw footage (audio and video) and develop titles and motion graphics.?	Willingness to learn new software and industry trends as they come in and out of style.Requirements:?	Graduate of Fine Arts from a reputable school or equivalent of 3-5 years of formal design training and/or experience.?	Strong understanding of Adobe Creative Suite - Adobe Premiere, After Effects, Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator.?	Strong experience with non-linear editing.?	Experience in producing content for YouTube or other online platforms & websites.?	The ability to self-manage and work on multiple projects per week.?	Take quality notes, document work, and translate client directives into a finalized product.?	An excellent grasp of typography, color, imagery and composition.?	Should possess excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to interact with others using sensitivity, tact and sound judgment.?	A key understanding of the client revision process — and working through revisions diligently.?	Strong animation, light editing, and/or audio editing skills are a plus.

Director Creativo y de Producción Nuevo León Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo,  Categoría: Creatividad, Producción y Diseño Comercial,  Dirección Creativo ¡Aquí está la oportunidad que buscas para lograr tu propósito de vida y convertirte en tu mejor versión! En México existen más de 3,200 instituciones que brindan un servicio de educación superior, pero sólo Tecmilenio integra el propósito de vida de las personas como eje de su Modelo Educativo. Actualmente contamos con 29 campus ubicados en 18 estados de México, más de 56,000 alumnos y 6,000 colaboradores. Desde el 2012, declaramos como nuestra visión el "formar personas con propósito de vida y las competencias para alcanzarlo". Gracias a nuestro Modelo de Universidad, nuestros alumnos tienen la posibilidad de diseñar su programa de estudios de acuerdo a sus intereses y con un 40% de flexibilidad, lo que nos hace únicos en el mundo.  En esta posición el reto principal es asegurar el desarrollo de contenidos audiovisuales, Gestión de identidad de marca, administración de banco de imágenes, gestión de agencias productoras y creativas. Actividades:Generar ideas y contenidos creativos para potencializar el orgullo y reputación con las audienciasDesarrollo de materiales gráficos ya audiovisuales para cada producto y audienciaGestión del proceso de requerimientos de materiaes gráficos y audiovisuales para todos los campus y públicosResponsable de la gestión de producción para todos los materiales de la universidad incluídas agenciasAsegirar el uso correcto y ejecución de la identidad de marca en piezas gráficasDesarrollo de propuestas creativas a través de la inclusión de alumnos - los alumnos como gestores de creatividadEste puesto es para ti si: Cuentas con Licenciatura y maestría terminadasTienes al menos 5 años de experiencia como responsable del desarrollo de propuestas creativas y diseño de materiales de impresión y piezas audiovisualesExperiencia en gestión de agencias y dirección de equipos creativosManejo de inglés a nivel avanzado Si eres una persona que crea ideas y las hace realidad, rompe paradigmas, toma riesgos, y aprende de los errores si estás dispuesto a impulsar cambios y transformar a México a través de la educación, este es el lugar que estás buscando. Se parte del equipo de colaboradores que piensa que puede transformar el mundo, resolviendo los problemas del futuro hoy. Ubicación: Tecmilenio Campus Las Torres En Tecmilenio actuamos bajo un principio de igualdad de oportunidades. Por ello no discriminamos por edad, origen étnico, nacionalidad, género, orientación sexual, estado civil, condición social, estado de salud, creencias religiosas, doctrina política o discapacidad.
